intro: Trichostema simulatum, commonly known as the mimic madia, is a flowering plant native to California. It belongs to the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its hairy stems and showy blue or violet flowers. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as grasslands and disturbed soils. Its leaves are opposite and often covered in fine, glandular hairs. Trichostema simulatum is known for its ability to mimic the appearance of other flowering plants, which may aid in its pollination strategy.
